page.title: 03The River Barle in Dulverton
page.content: The River Barle flows through Dulverton.It is a small,fast flowing river,passing over rocks all along.In places there are deep pools where trout can be found.The children of Dulverton go fishing off the bridge, and also up to Weir Head. The bridge is an ancient mounument. It has five arches and there are two inscriptions on it saying "Dulverton bridge,repaired in the year of our Lord Christ 1684",and the other "Widened 1819 by John Stone". Sometimes,in winter,the river floods,and water rushes through Exmoor House,the Bridge Inn,and other houses. So this year the Water Authority has spent a lot of money putting up a flood wall,and digging out around the bridge.
